articles.title: Chicago airports add boxes for travelers to dump marijuana
articles.description: CHICAGO (AP) — Chicago's O’Hare and Midway international airports have added boxes where travelers can dispose of recreational marijuana before they board their flights.
articles.content:
CHICAGO (AP) Chicago's OHare and Midway international airports have added boxes where travelers can dispose of recreational marijuana before they board their flights.
The cannabis amnesty boxes, as theyre called, were installed at each airport last week, jus… [+1361 chars]

articles.author: By AMANDA CUDA Connecticut Post
articles.title: Man’s life saved by technology he helped develop
articles.description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn. (AP) — It’s not lost on Louis Voros that he helped create something that saved his life.
articles.content:
BRIDGEPORT, Conn. (AP) Its not lost on Louis Voros that he helped create something that saved his life.
Voros, 77, of Fairfield, is a retired mechanical engineer. During his career, he said, he worked on a lot of medical products, including da Vinci Surgical… [+3678 chars]

articles.title: One dead, three injured in shooting in central Ottawa
articles.description: OTTAWA, Ontario (AP) — Ottawa police said Wednesday one person was killed and three seriously injured in a shooting in a central part of the city.
articles.content:
OTTAWA, Ontario (AP) Ottawa police said Wednesday one person was killed and three seriously injured in a shooting in a central part of the city.
Acting Insp. Francois D'Aoust said police were looking for a suspect.

articles.title: Troopers: 2 men die when car slams into tree in Fort Myers
articles.description: FORT MYERS, Fla. (AP) — Two men are dead following a car crash early Wednesday morning in Fort Myers, the Florida Highway Patrol said.
articles.content:
FORT MYERS, Fla. (AP) Two men are dead following a car crash early Wednesday morning in Fort Myers, the Florida Highway Patrol said.

articles.title: Connecticut at forefront of local census outreach efforts
articles.description: WATERBURY, Conn. (AP) — Arixsa Vargas has lived and worked in the city’s South End all her life, but the 46-year-old said she’s never seen a census form.
articles.content:

articles.title: Poll: World skeptical Trump will do right in global affairs
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The world is still skeptical that after nearly three years in office President Donald Trump will do the right thing on foreign affairs, according to Pew Research Center polling released Wednesday.
